METS_Profile.title: E-ARK CSIP METS Profile
METS_Profile.abstract: This base profile describes the Common Specification for Information Packages (CSIP) and the implementation of METS for packaging OAIS conformant Information Packages. The profile is accompanied with a text document explaning the details of use of this profile. This will enable repository interoperability and assist in the management of the preservation of digital content. This profile is a base profile which is extended with E-ARK implementation of SIP, AIP and DIP. The profile can be used as is, but it is recommended that the supplied extending implementation are used. Alternatively, an own extension fulfilling the extending needs of the implementer can be created.
METS_Profile.related_profile: This profile has no related profiles

resource_model.head: Principles for a package conforming to the Common Specification for Information Packages (CSIP)

external_schema.name: E-ARK CSIP METS Extension
external_schema.context: XML-schema for the attributes added by CSIP

note.p: An extension schema with the added attributes for use in this profile.
The schema is identified using the namespace prefix csip.
A rule set for use with this profile is under development.

description_rules.p: The filepath must be decoded consistently throughout all file references within the information package.

description.p: Lists the names of specific E-ARK content information type specifications supported or maintained in this METS profile.
Declares the categorical classification of package content.
Describes the OAIS type the package belongs to in the OAIS reference model.
Provides values for the type of a note for an agent.
Describes the other agent types supported by the profile.
Describes the type of the identifier.
Describes the status of the descriptive metadata section (dmdSec) which is supported by the profile.
Valid values for the mime types of referenced files.
Describes the uses of the file group `<fileGrp>` that are supported by the profile.
Own names should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.
Describes the type of the structural map `<structMap>` that is supported by the profile.
Own types should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.
Describes the label of the structural map that is supported by the profile.
Own labels should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

description.head: Package Identifier
description.p: The `mets/@OBJID` attribute is mandatory, its value is a string identifier for the METS document. For the package METS document, this should be the name/ID of the package, i.e. the name of the package root folder.
For a representation level METS document this value records the name/ID of the representation, i.e. the name of the top-level representation folder.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The mets/@OBJID attribute is mandatory, its value is a string identifier for the METS document. For the package METS document, this should be the name/ID of the package, i.e. the name of the package root folder. For a representation level METS document this value records the name/ID of the representation, i.e. the name of the top-level representation folder.

description.head: Content Category
description.p: The `mets/@TYPE` attribute MUST be used to declare the category of the content held in the package, e.g. "Datasets", "Websites", "Mixes" , "Other", etc.. Legal values are defined in a fixed vocabulary. When the content category used falls outside of the defined vocabulary the `mets/@TYPE` value must be set to "OTHER" and the specific value declared in `mets/@csip:OTHERTYPE`. The vocabulary will develop under the curation of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are produced.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The mets/@TYPE attibute MUST be used to declare the category of the content held in the package, e.g. book, journal, stereograph, video, etc.. Legal values are defined in a fixed vocabulary.

description.head: Other Content Category
description.p: When the `mets/@TYPE` attribute has the value "OTHER" the `mets/@csip:OTHERTYPE` attribute MUST be used to declare the content category of the package/representation. The value can either be "OTHER" or any other string that are not present in the vocabulary used in the `mets/@TYPE` attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: When the content category used falls outside of the defined vocabulary the mets/@TYPE value must be set to “OTHER” and the specific value declared in mets/@csip:OTHERTYPE. The vocabulary will develop under the curation of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are produced.

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: Used to declare the Content Information Type Specification used when creating the package. Legal values are defined in a fixed vocabulary. The attribute is mandatory for representation level METS documents. The vocabulary will evolve under the care of the DILCIS Board as additional Content Information Type Specifications are developed.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Used to declare the Content Information Type Specification used when creating the package. Legal values are defined in a fixed vocabulary. The attribute is mandatory for representation level METS documents.

description.head: Other Content Information Type Specification
description.p: When the `mets/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` has the value "OTHER" the `mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` must state the content information type.

iso:rule.iso:assert: When the mets/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE has the value “OTHER” the mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE must state the content information type.

description.head: METS Profile
description.p: The URL of the METS profile that the information package conforms with.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The PROFILE attribute MUST contain the URL of the METS profile that the information package conforms with.

description.head: Package header
description.p: General element for describing the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: There MUST be a general element that describes the package.

description.head: Package creation datetime
description.p: `mets/metsHdr/@CREATEDATE` records the date and time the package was created.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The metsHdr element MUST have a CREATEDATE attribute.

description.head: Package last modification datetime
description.p: `mets/metsHdr/@LASTMODDATE` records the data and time the package was modified and is mandatory when the package has been modified.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The metsHdr element SHOULD have a LASTMODDATE attribute.

description.head: OAIS Package type information
description.p: `mets/metsHdr/@csip:OAISPACKAGETYPE` is an additional CSIP attribute that declares the type of the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The metsHdr element MUST have a csip:OAISPACKAGETYPE attribute.

description.head: Agent
description.p: A mandatory agent element records the software used to create the package. Other uses of agents may be described in any local implementations that extend the profile.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The metsHdr element MUST contain an agent element that records the software used to create the package.

description.head: Agent role
description.p: The mandatory agent element MUST have a `@ROLE` attribute with the value “CREATOR”.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The agent element MUST have a ROLE attribute with the value "CREATOR".

description.head: Agent type
description.p: The mandatory agent element MUST have a `@TYPE` attribute with the value “OTHER”.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The agent element MUST have a TYPE attribute with the value "OTHER".

description.head: Agent other type
description.p: The mandatory agent element MUST have a `@OTHERTYPE` attribute with the value “SOFTWARE”.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The agent element MUST have a OTHERTYPE attribute with the value "SOFTWARE".

description.head: Agent name
description.p: The mandatory agent's name element records the name of the software tool used to create the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The agent element MUST have a child name element that records the name of the software tool used to create the IP.

description.head: Agent additional information
description.p: The mandatory agent's note element records the version of the tool used to create the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The agent element MUST have a child note element that records the version of the tool used to create the IP.

description.head: Classification of the agent additional information
description.p: The mandatory agent element's note child has a `@csip:NOTETYPE` attribute with a fixed value of "SOFTWARE VERSION".

iso:rule.iso:assert: The mandatory agent element’s note child has a @csip:NOTETYPE attribute with a fixed value of “SOFTWARE VERSION”.

description.head: Descriptive metadata
description.p: Must be used if descriptive metadata for the package content is available. Each descriptive metadata section (`<dmdSec>`) contains a single description and must be repeated for multiple descriptions, when available.
It is possible to transfer metadata in a package using just the descriptive metadata section and/or administrative metadata section.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Must be used if descriptive metadata about the package content is available. NOTE: According to official METS documentation each metadata section must describe one and only one set of metadata. As such, if implementers want to include multiple occurrences of descriptive metadata into the package this must be done by repeating the whole dmdSec element for each individual metadata.

description.head: Descriptive metadata identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the descriptive metadata section (`<dmdSec>`) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Descriptive metadata creation datetime
description.p: Creation date and time of the descriptive metadata in this section.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, creation date of the descriptive metadata in this section.

description.head: Status of the descriptive metadata
description.p: Indicates the status of the package using a fixed vocabulary.

iso:rule.iso:assert: SHOULD be used to indicated the status of the package.

description.head: Reference to the document with the descriptive metadata
description.p: Reference to the descriptive metadata file located in the “metadata” section of the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: SHOULD provide a reference to the descriptive metadata file located in the “metadata” section of the IP..

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The locator type is always used with the value “URL” from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath in this attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath in this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the referenced file. Values are taken from the list provided by the METS.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Specifies the type of metadata in the referenced file. Values are taken from the list provided by the METS.

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST hold the IANA mime type of the referenced file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the referenced file in bytes.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST hold the size of the referenced file in bytes.

description.head: File creation datetime
description.p: The creation date and time of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST hold the creation date of the referenced file.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST hold the checksum of the referenced file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: A value from the METS-standard which identifies the algorithm used to calculate the checksum for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST hold the algorithm type of checksum of the referenced file.

description.head: Administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative / preservation metadata is available, it must be described using the administrative metadata section (`<amdSec>`) element.
All administrative metadata is present in a single `<amdSec>` element.
It is possible to transfer metadata in a package using just the descriptive metadata section and/or administrative metadata section.

iso:rule.iso:assert: If administrative / preservation metadata is available, it must be described using the administrative metadata section (amdSec) element. All administrative metadata is present in a single amdSec element.

description.head: Digital provenance metadata
description.p: For recording information about preservation the standard PREMIS is used. It is mandatory to include one `<digiprovMD>` element for each piece of PREMIS metadata.
The use if PREMIS in METS is following the recommendations in the 2017 version of PREMIS in METS Guidelines.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Sould be used to record information about preservation the standard PREMIS is used.

description.head: Digital provenance metadata identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the digital provenance metadata section `mets/amdSec/digiprovMD` used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, unique id for the digital provenance.

description.head: Status of the digital provenance metadata
description.p: Indicates the status of the package using a fixed vocabulary.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Should be used to indicate the status of the package.e

description.head: Reference to the document with the digital provenance metadata
description.p: Reference to the digital provenance metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Should provide a reference to the digital provenance metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, locator type is always used with the value “URL” from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Attribute MUST be used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the referenced file. Values are taken from the list provided by the METS.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the type of metadata at the referenced location.

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the MIME type of the referenced file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the referenced file in bytes.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the size in bytes of the referenced file.

description.head: File creation datetime
description.p: Creation date and time of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the date the referenced file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum of the referenced file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: A value from the METS-standard which identifies the algorithm used to calculate the checksum for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum type of the referenced file.

description.head: Rights metadata
description.p: A simple rights statement may be used to describe general permissions for the package. Individual representations should state their specific rights in their representation METS file.

Available standards include RightsStatements.org, Europeana rights statements info, METS Rights Schema created and maintained by the METS Board, the rights part of PREMIS as well as own local rights statements in use.

iso:rule.iso:assert: A simple rights statement may be used to describe general permissions for the package. Individual representations should state their specific rights in their representation METS file.

description.head: Rights metadata identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the rights metadata section (`<rightsMD>`) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, unique id for the rights metadata.e

description.head: Status of the rights metadata
description.p: Indicates the status of the package using a fixed vocabulary.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Should be used to indicate the status of the package.

description.head: Reference to the document with the rights metadata
description.p: Reference to the rights metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Should provide a reference to the digital provenance metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, locator type is always used with the value “URL” from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Attribute MUST be used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the referenced file. Value is taken from the list provided by the METS.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the type of metadata at the referenced location.e

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the MIME type of the referenced file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the referenced file in bytes.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the size in bytes of the referenced file.

description.head: File creation datetime
description.p: Creation date and time of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the date the referenced file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum of the referenced file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: A value from the METS-standard which identifies the algorithm used to calculate the checksum for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum type of the referenced file.

description.head: File section
description.p: References to all transferred content SHOULD be placed in the file section in the different file group elements, described in other requirements.
Only a single file section (`<fileSec>`) element should be present.
In the case that a package only contains metadata updates, i.e. exclusively metadata files, then no file references need to be added to this section.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The transferred content is placed in the file section in different file group elements, described in other requirements.

description.head: File section identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the file section used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: An xml:id identifier for the file section used for internal package references.

description.head: Documentation file group
description.p: All documentation pertaining to the transferred content is placed in one or more file group elements with `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` attribute value "Documentation".

iso:rule.iso:assert: All documentation pertaining to the transferred content is placed in one or more file group elements with mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE attribute value “Documentation”.

description.head: Schema file group
description.p: All XML schemas used in the information package must be referenced from one or more file groups with `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` attribute value "Schemas".

iso:rule.iso:assert: All XML schemas used in the information package should be referenced from one or more file groups with mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE attribute value “Schemas”.

description.head: Representations file group
description.p: A pointer to the METS document describing the representation or pointers to the content being transferred must be present in one or more file groups with `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` attribute value starting with "Representations" followed by the path to the folder where the representation level METS document is placed. For example "Representation/submission" and "Representation/ingest".

iso:rule.iso:assert: A pointer to the METS document describing the representation or pointers to the content being transferred must be present in one or more file groups with mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE attribute value “Representations”.

description.head: Reference to administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata has been provided at file group `mets/fileSec/fileGrp` level this attribute refers to its administrative metadata section by ID.

iso:rule.iso:assert: ADMID attribute used.

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: An added attribute which states the name of the content information type specification used to create the package.
The vocabulary will evolve under the curation of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are developed.

When the element "Content Information Type Specification" (CSIP4) has the value "MIXED" or the file group describes a representation, then this element states the content information type specification used for the file group.

When the element "Representations file group" (CSIP114), the file group describes a representation with the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` attribute value is starting with "Representations", then this element must state the content information type specification used for the representation.

description.head: Other Content Information Type Specification
description.p: When the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute has the value "OTHER" the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` must state a value for the Content Information Type Specification used.

description.head: Description of the use of the file group
description.p: The value in the `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@USE` is the name of the whole folder structure to the data, e.g "Documentation", "Schemas", "Representations/preingest" or "Representations/submission/data".

iso:rule.iso:assert: This attribute is mandatory.

description.head: File group identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the file group used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: This attribute is mandatory. An xml:id identifier for the file group used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: File
description.p: The file group (`<fileGrp>`) contains the file elements which describe the file objects.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The file group contains the file elements which describe the file objects.

description.head: File identifier
description.p: A unique `xml:id` identifier for this file across the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: This attribute is mandatory. An xml:id identifier for the file group used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: File mimetype
description.p: The IANA mime type for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the MIME type of the referenced file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the referenced file in bytes.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the size in bytes of the referenced file.

description.head: File creation datetime
description.p: Creation date and time of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the date the referenced file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum of the referenced file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: A value from the METS-standard which identifies the algorithm used to calculate the checksum for the referenced file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the checksum type of the referenced file.

description.head: File original identification
description.p: If an identifier for the file was supplied by the owner it can be recorded in this attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: A file element has an OWNERID attribute.

description.head: File reference to administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata has been provided for the file this attribute refers to the file's administrative metadata by ID.

iso:rule.iso:assert: A file element has an ADMID attribute.

description.head: File reference to descriptive metadata
description.p: If descriptive metadata has been provided per file this attribute refers to the file's descriptive metadata by ID.

iso:rule.iso:assert: A file element has an DMDID attribute.

description.head: File locator reference
description.p: The location of each external file must be defined by the file location `<FLocat>` element using the same rules as references for metadata files. All references to files should be made using the XLink href attribute and the file protocol using the relative location of the file.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The location of each external file must be defined by the file location FLocat element.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Mandatory, locator type is always used with the value “URL” from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Attribute MUST be used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

iso:rule.iso:assert: MUST record the actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Structural description of the package
description.p: The structural map `<structMap>` element is the only mandatory element in the METS.
The `<structMap>` in the CSIP describes the highest logical structure of the IP.
Every CSIP compliant METS file must include ONE structural map `<structMap>` element used exactly as described in this section of requirements.
Institutions can add their own additional custom structural maps as separate `<structMap>` sections following their own requirements.

iso:rule.iso:assert: Each METS file must include ONE structural map structMap element used exactly as described here.

description.head: Type of structural description
description.p: The `mets/structMap/@TYPE` attribute must take the value “PHYSICAL” from the vocabulary.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The mets/structMap/@TYPE attribute must take the value “PHYSICAL” from the vocabulary.

description.head: Name of the structural description
description.p: The `mets/structMap/@LABEL` attribute value is set to “CSIP” from the vocabulary.
This requirement identifies the CSIP compliant structural map `<structMap>` element.

iso:rule.iso:assert: The mets/structMap/@LABEL attribute value is set to “CSIP” from the vocabulary.

description.head: Structural description identifier
description.p: An `xml:id` identifier for the structural description (structMap) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

iso:rule.iso:assert: An xml:id identifier for the structural description (structMap) used for internal package references. It must be unique within the package.

description.head: Main structural division
description.p: The structural map comprises a single division.

description.head: Main structural division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Metadata division
description.p: The metadata referenced in the administrative and/or descriptive metadata section is described in the structural map with one sub division.
When the transfer consists of only administrative and/or descriptive metadata this is the only sub division that occurs.

description.head: Metadata division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Metadata division label
description.p: The metadata division `<div>` element's `@LABEL` attribute value must be "Metadata".

description.head: Metadata division references administrative metadata
description.p: The admimistrative metadata division should reference all current administrative metadata sections.
All `<amdSec>`s with `@STATUS='CURRENT'` SHOULD be referenced by their identifier, @ID.
The current `<amdSec>` @IDs are recorded in the `div[@LABEL='Metadata']/@ADMID` attribute in a space delimited list.

description.head: Metadata division references descriptive metadata
description.p: The descriptive metadata division should reference all current descriptive metadata sections.
All `<dmdSec>`s with `@STATUS='CURRENT'` SHOULD be referenced by their identifier, @ID.
The current `<dmdSec>` @IDs are recorded in the `div[@LABEL='Metadata']/@DMDID` attribute in a space delimited list.

description.head: Documentation division
description.p: The documentation referenced in the file section file groups is described in the structural map with one sub division.

description.head: Documentation division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Documentation division label
description.p: The documentation division `<div>` element in the package uses the value "Documentation" from the vocabulary as the value for the `@LABEL` attribute.

description.head: Documentation file references
description.p: All file groups containing documentation described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers. There MUST be one file group reference per `<fptr>` element.

description.head: Documentation file group reference pointer
description.p: A reference, by ID, to the "Documentation" file group.
Related to the requirements CSIP60 which describes the "Documentation" file group and CSIP65 which describes the file group identifier.

description.head: Schema division
description.p: The schemas referenced in the file section file groups are described in the structural map within a single sub-division.

description.head: Schema division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Schema division label
description.p: The schema division `<div>` element's `@LABEL` attribute has the value "Schemas" from the vocabulary.

description.head: Schema file reference
description.p: All file groups containing schemas described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers. One file group reference per fptr-element

description.head: Schema file group reference
description.p: The pointer to the identifier for the "Schema" file group.
Related to the requirements CSIP113 which describes the "Schema" file group and CSIP65 which describes the file group identifier.

description.head: Content division
description.p: When no representations are present the content referenced in the file section file group with `@USE` attribute value "Representations" is described in the structural map as a single sub division.

description.head: Content division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Content division label
description.p: The package's content division `<div>` element must have the `@LABEL` attribute value "Representations", taken from the vocabulary.

description.head: Content division file references
description.p: All file groups containing content described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers. One file group reference per fptr-element.

description.head: Content division file group references
description.p: The pointer to the identifier for the "Representations" file group.
Related to the requirements CSIP114 which describes the "Representations" file group and CSIP65 which describes the file group identifier.

description.head: Representation division
description.p: When a package consists of multiple representations, each described by a representation level METS.xml document, there should be a discrete representation div element for each representation.
Each representation div references the representation level METS.xml document, documenting the structure of the package and its constituent representations.

description.head: Representations division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, `xml:id` identifier must be unique within the package.

description.head: Representations division label
description.p: The package's representation division `<div>` element `@LABEL` attribute value must be the path to the representation level METS document starting with the value "Representations" followed by the main folder name for example "Representations/submission" and "Representations/ingest".
This requirement gives the same value to be used as the requirement named "Description of the use of the file group" (CSIP64)

description.head: Representations division file references
description.p: The file group containing the files described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifier.
Related to the requirements CSIP114 which describes the "Representations" file group and CSIP65 which describes the file group identifier.

description.head: Representation METS pointer
description.p: The division `<div>` of the specific representation includes one occurrence of the METS pointer `<mptr>` element, pointing to the appropriate representation METS file.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: structLink
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the structural links is found in the METS Primer

description.head: behaviorSec
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the behaviour section is found in the METS Primer
Requriments not stated in CSIP
Requriments not stated in CSIP
Requriments not stated in CSIP

A suite of tools for e-archiving and digital preservation. The tools provide functionality for producers to archive digital information, for archives to preserve digital information and for consumers to access archived information.

RODA is a digital repository solution that delivers functionality for all the main units of the OAIS reference model. RODA is capable of ingesting, managing and providing access to the various types of digital objects produced by large corporations or public bodies. RODA is based on open-source technologies and is supported by existing standards such as the Open Archival Information System (OAIS), Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS), Encoded Archival Description (EAD), Dublin Core (DC) and PREMIS (Preservation Metadata).

note.p: RODA is licensed under LGPLv3 for all source-code including interoperability libraries like SIP manipulation libraries.

description.p: RODA-in is a tool specially designed for producers and archivists to create Submission Information Packages (SIP) ready to be submitted to an Open Archival Information System (OAIS). The tool creates SIPs from files and folders available on the local file system.
RODA-in supports several Submission Information Package formats such as BagIt, E-ARK SIP and the Hungarian SIP format.

Example.LABEL: METS root element showing use of `csip:@OTHERTYPE` attribute when an appropriate package content category value is not available in the vocabulary. The `@TYPE` attribute value is set to OTHER.

METS root element illustrating the use of a custom `csip:@OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute value when the correct content type value does note exist in the vocabulary. The `csip:@CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute value is set to OTHER.
